quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Characters and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, john, sethe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Ari, Dov, Kitty Fremont, Akiva, Bruce Sutherland are characters in this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Exodus

questions.question: Which book includes the characters John Converse, Ray Hicks, Marge Converse?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dog Soldiers

questions.question: What novel by Vladimir Nabokov was banned for obscenity in England, Argentina, New Zealand and South Africa?

options.text: Fanny Hill or Memoirs of a Woman of Pleasure

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lolita

questions.question: Who is the author of the book My Struggle (Mein Kampf) which was banned due to anti-Nazi laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adolph Hitler

questions.question: What novel by Erich Maria Remarque was banned in Nazi Germany for insulting the Wehrmacht?

options.text: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.question: Willie Stark, Anne Stanton, Judge Montague Irving are characters from this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All the Kings Men

questions.question: Name the author of Animal Farm, an anti-Stalinist novella, which was confiscated in Germany by Allied troops.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Orwell

questions.question: John Singer, Mick Kelly, Biff Brannon, Jack Blount, Dr. Copeland are characters described in this literary work.

options.text: The Heart is a Lonely Hunter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Heart is a Lonely Hunter

questions.question: This book, published in 1988, was banned in Bangladesh, India, Singapore and Iran for blasphemous references and its author Salman Rushdie was condemned to death by former Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Satanic Verses

questions.question: What novels includes characters named Sethe, Liz Granacher, Paul D. McKnight, Charlie McKnight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beloved

questions.question: Paul Sheldon and Annie Wilkes are characters in this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Misery

questions.question: This novel focuses on the lives of Jake Barnes, Brett Ashley, Robert Cohn, Pedro Romero, Bill Gorton, Michael Campbell.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sun Also Rises

questions.question: Which of these books by Henry Miller was banned in the US in the 1930s due to sexually explicit content?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Humbert Humbert, Valeria and Charlotte Haze are characters from this literary work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lolita

questions.question: What Southern novel centers on the lives of these characters: Jason, Quentin, Candice Compson, Dilsey Gibson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sound and the Fury

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Sentence
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, best-selling, commencement. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This novel opens with the following sentence: You may rejoice to hear that a disaster has accompanied the commencement of an enterprise which you have regarded with such evil foreboding..
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frankenstein

questions.question: Last night I dreamt I went to Manderley again is the first sentence of this literary work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rebecca

questions.question: What 2003 best-selling novel by Dan Brown was denounced by Roman Catholics for being anti-Christian?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Da Vinci Code

questions.question: Finish this quote by Oscar Wilde: Education is an admirable thing ........................

options.text: but it is well to remember that it is useless
but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught
but it is well to remember that it is not for the faint of heart
but it is well to remember that it requires much energy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught

questions.question: What novel opens with this sentence: I was born in the year 1632 in the city of York, of a good  family thou not of that country, my father being from Bremen, who settled first at Hill.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robinson Crusoe

questions.question: This novel opens with the question Who is John Galt?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlas Shrugged

questions.question: You better not tell nobody  but God is the beginning of this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Color Purple

questions.question: Mother died today is the opening of this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Stranger

questions.question: This novel, which follows the adventures of junkie William Lee, was banned by Boston courts in 1962.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Naked Lunch

questions.question: What novel opens with this line: It was a cold day in April and the clock was striking thirteen.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1984

questions.question: What classic satirical novel by Jonathan Swift was banned in Ireland for being wicked and obscene?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gullivers Travels

questions.question: All this happened, more or less is the first sentence of this book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slaughterhouse  Five

questions.question: What Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, set during the Great Depression, was banned in some US States for vulgar language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Grapes of Wrath

questions.question: Which literary work opens with this line: To be born again, sang Gibreel Farishta tumbling from the heavens, first you have to die.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Satanic Verses

questions.question: To begin at the beginning: It is spring, moonless night in the small town is the opening of this literary work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Under Milk Wood

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Oscar Wilde and Quote
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, wildes, denmark. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The protagonist of this Shakespearean tragedy is a Moor in the service of the Republic of Venice.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Othello

questions.question: Complete this remark made by Irish author Oscar Wilde: There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating ..................

options.text: people who owe you money, and people you avoid
people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing.
people with a thirst for knowledge, and idiots
people who care, and people who dont give a damn

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing.

questions.question: This comedy by Shakespeare, characterized by a lot of mix-ups and witty dialogue, involves two sets of identical twins.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Comedy of Errors

questions.question: Finish this statement made by Oscar Wilde: America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without .............................
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: civilization in between

questions.question: Finish this quote by Oscar Wilde: Anyone who lives within their means suffers from ...................................

options.text: a lack of friends with money
a lack of wealthy family members

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a lack of imagination

questions.question: Complete this Oscar Wilde quote: We have really everything in common with America nowadays except, of course ..........................
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: language

questions.question: How does this Oscar Wilde quote end: My wallpaper and I are fighting a duel to the death. ................................ ?

options.text: I will shred it off the walls if I have to
One or other of us has got to go
I have counted every flower twice
One or the other will win the battle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One or other of us has got to go

questions.question: Finish this line from Oscar Wildes play The Importance of Being Earnest: To lose one parent, Mr Worthing, may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both ................................
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: looks like carelessness

questions.question: What Shakespeare play opens with a street brawl in Verona between the servants of two feuding noble families?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romeo and Juliet

questions.question: This tragedy, often referred to as The Scottish Play, opens with the appearance of three witches amid thunder and lightning.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Macbeth

questions.question: Finish this witty remark made by playwright Oscar Wilde: We are all in the gutter, but some of us ............
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: are looking at the stars

questions.question: What Shakespearean tragedy, set in Denmark, explores the themes of treachery and revenge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamlet

questions.question: This history play by Shakespeare, focusing on a kings Machiavellian rise to power and subsequent reign of terror, contains the following exchange:

options.text: t I know none, and therefore am no beast.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard III

questions.question: Complete this quote by Oscar Wilde: But what is the difference between literature and journalism?........................................

options.text: Literature is art and journalism is rubbish. That is all.
Journalism is unreadable and literature is not read. That is all.
Journalism is an account of facts and literature is fiction. That is all.
Literature is the only thing worth reading. That is all.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Journalism is unreadable and literature is not read. That is all.

questions.question: A speaker who had a huge opinion of himself gave a long and boring speech after dinner. And then made the mistake of turning to Oscar Wilde, and asking him, How would you have delivered that speech? . What was Oscar Wildes reply?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Under an assumed name

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Pride and Prejudice
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, austins, monologues. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the novel Pride and Prejudice, how many daughters do Mr. and Mrs. Bennet have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: five

questions.question: Which of these professions has Mr. Wickham not tried in the book Pride and Prejudice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Groundskeeper

questions.question: Which of these characters from the novel Pride and Prejudice is Elizabeth Bennets neighbour and friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlotte Lucas

questions.question: This Polish-born novelist, whose surname was Korzeniowski, wrote the influential work Heart of Darkness that inspired the movie Apocalypse Now.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Conrad

questions.question: Shakespeares history play Henry V depicts events occurring immediately before and after the Battle of Agincourt. During which war was this battle fought?

options.text: the War of the Rough Wooing

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Hundred Years War

questions.question: In the book Pride and Prejudice, Mr. Wickham has his wife write a letter to Elizabeth asking for money.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This pastoral comedy contains one of Shakespeares most quoted monologues, which opens with the lines, All the worlds a stage,

options.text: d all the men and women merely players.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: As You Like It

questions.question: Who does Lydia run away with in Jane Austins book Pride and Prejudice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wickham

questions.question: How many marriage proposals does Elizabeth receive in the book Pride and Prejudice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: What Shakespearean play features a character who possesses magical powers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tempest

questions.question: Which sister has an uncontrollable cough in the beginning of the novel Pride and Prejudice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katherine

questions.question: What was the pen name of Eric Blair, the author of the novel Animal Farm, which satirizes totalitarian government and human stupidity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Orwell

questions.question: One of the major themes of this romantic comedy, incorporating mythological elements, is summed up in Lysanders comment, “The course of true love never did run smooth”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Midsummer Nights Dream

questions.question: What is the real name of the American author and humorist whose nickname was a common riverboat phrase, meaning the water is two fathoms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel Clemens

questions.question: Which Bennet sister loves to exhibit her talent at parties according to the novel Pride and Prejudice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Mark Twain and Pen
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, humors, agatha. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: FInish the popular quote by Mark Twain: ...each place has its advantages - heaven for climate and hell for...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: society.

questions.question: What prominent Victorian author began his career writing humorous sketches for The Morning Chronicle, using the pen-name Boz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Dickens

questions.question: What is the correct answer to the following question according to writer an humorist Mark Twain: What’s the difference between a taxidermist and a tax collector?

options.text: The taxidemist only takes your skin.
The tax collector is an elected official.
There is no difference. They both skin you.
The tax collector has no warm blood.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The taxidemist only takes your skin.

questions.question: Which of these is both the name of a fictional character and a pseudonym used by two co-writers of detective fiction?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellery Queen

questions.question: Finish this humors remark by Mark Twain: The report of my death was...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: an exaggeration.

questions.question: What is the correct ending of the following quote by Mark Twain: Always obey your parents - especially when...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: they are present.

questions.question: How were the authors, writing under the pen names Ellis Bell, Acton Bell and Currer Bell, related?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were sisters.

questions.question: Which is the correct ending of this quotation by Mark Twain: A classic is something everybody wants to have read and...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: nobody wants to read.

questions.question: Which of these is not the pen name of a female author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saki

questions.question: How does this thought by Mark Twain end: Man is the only religious animal. He is the only animal that has the True Religion--?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: several of them.

questions.question: Which of the following is one of the six novels by Agatha Christie, written under the pen name Mary Westmacott?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Absent in the Spring

questions.question: Finish this popular thought by humorist and author Mark Twain:Always do right. This will gratify some people and...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: astonish the rest.

questions.question: What is the pen name of the Russian-born American novelist known for her best-selling novels The Fountainhead and Atlas Shrugged?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ayn Rand

questions.question: Which of these is a pseudonym used by Theodor Geisel, the iconic American author of over 60 childrens books including Green Eggs and Ham and The Cat in the Hat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Finish this popular thought by Mark Twain: Compliments embarass me - I always feel that they...

options.text: make me feel old and too revered.
give me too much credit for things other people have done.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: havent said enough.

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Agatha Christie and Agatha
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, agatha, period. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Three authors were said to have influenced Agatha Christie. Which of these is not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

questions.question: What was the occupation of Agatha Christies second husband?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: archaeologist

questions.question: How does this thought by Mark Twain end: To be good is noble; but to show others how to be good is nobler and...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: is no trouble.

questions.question: In 1979, this actress played the part of Agatha Christie in the film Agatha.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanessa Redgrave

questions.question: Agatha Christie has been called by the Guinness Book of World Records the 2nd best-selling author of all time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the correct ending of the following thought by Mark Twain: Everybody talks about the weather, but...?

options.text: no one does anything about it.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: no one does anything about it.

questions.question: Agatha Christie died in 1985 at the age of 76.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Name the Faulknerian character from As I Lay Dying who states the following: My mother is a fish.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vardaman

questions.question: Agatha Christies birth name was Mary Katherine Francis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Agatha Christie wrote romances under the name Mary Westmacott.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What romantic period author created the Byronic hero, Heathcliff?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Bronte

questions.question: Agatha Christie met her second husband at a theatre entrance in London, England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Kurt Vonnegut created the character Billy Pilgrim in his novel Breakfast of Champions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who wrote the play, The Jew of Malta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marlowe

questions.question: Which detective novel by Agatha Christie introduced Miss Marple to readers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Murder at the Vicarage
